segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image Using a USB Flash Drive
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image Using a USB Flash Drive

segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image Using a USB Flash Drive
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image Using a USB Flash Drive

segment.source: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image Using a USB Flash Drive
segment.target: How to Deploy the DaRT Recovery Image Using a USB Flash Drive

segment.source: After you have finished running the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard, you can use the tool at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=218888 to copy the ISO image file to a USB flash drive (UFD).
segment.target: After you have finished running the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard, you can use the tool at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=218888 to copy the ISO image file to a USB flash drive (UFD).

segment.source: You can also manually copy the ISO image file to a UFD by following the steps provided in this section.
segment.target: You can also manually copy the ISO image file to a UFD by following the steps provided in this section.

segment.source: To save the DaRT recovery image to a USB flash drive
segment.target: To save the DaRT recovery image to a USB flash drive

segment.source: Format the USB flash drive.
segment.target: Format the USB flash drive.

segment.source: From a running valid operating system or Windows PE session, insert your UFD.
segment.target: From a running valid operating system or Windows PE session, insert your UFD.

segment.source: At the command prompt with administrator permissions, type DISKPART and then type LIST DISK.
segment.target: At the command prompt with administrator permissions, type DISKPART and then type LIST DISK.

segment.source: The Command Prompt window displays the disk number of your UFD, for example DISK 1.
segment.target: The Command Prompt window displays the disk number of your UFD, for example DISK 1.

segment.source: Enter the following commands one at a time at the command prompt.
segment.target: Enter the following commands one at a time at the command prompt.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The previous code example assumes Disk 1 is the UFD.
segment.target: The previous code example assumes Disk 1 is the UFD.

segment.source: If it is necessary, replace DISK 1 with your disk number.
segment.target: If it is necessary, replace DISK 1 with your disk number.

segment.source: By using your company’s preferred method of mounting an image, mount the ISO image file that you created in the Create Startup Image dialog box of the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.
segment.target: By using your company’s preferred method of mounting an image, mount the ISO image file that you created in the Create Startup Image dialog box of the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.

segment.source: This requires that you have a method available to mount an image file.
segment.target: This requires that you have a method available to mount an image file.

segment.source: Open the mounted ISO image file and copy all its contents to the formatted USB flash drive.
segment.target: Open the mounted ISO image file and copy all its contents to the formatted USB flash drive.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you burned a CD or DVD of the recovery image, you can open the files on the CD or DVD and copy the contents to the UFD.
segment.target: If you burned a CD or DVD of the recovery image, you can open the files on the CD or DVD and copy the contents to the UFD.

segment.source: This lets you skip the need to mount the image.
segment.target: This lets you skip the need to mount the image.
